result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Arnold

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L Arnold appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Kevin L Arnold.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Case may be in deferred prosecution agreement posture and State requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin L Arnold appeared by video.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Kevin L Arnold.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has all discovery and an offer; requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin L Arnold in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin L Arnold appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-20-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Kevin L Arnold in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/18/22 @ 2p
